Identification.LongTitle: An Act to provide for the making of supplementary fiscal equalization payments to certain provinces for the period April 1, 1982 to March 31, 1987

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Supplementary Fiscal Equalization Payments 1982-87 Act.

In addition to the fiscal equalization payment amounts payable for the period April 1, 1982 to March 31, 1987 to each province entitled to a fiscal equalization payment under Part I of the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements and Federal Post-Secondary Education and Health Contributions Act, 1977, the Minister of Finance shall pay to each such province as a supplementary fiscal equalization payment, the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the fiscal year commencing on April 1, 1985,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one hundred and ten million dollars to the Province of Quebec,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fifty million dollars to the Province of Manitoba,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: twenty million dollars to the Province of Nova Scotia,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: twenty million dollars to the Province of New Brunswick,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: fifteen million dollars to the Province of Newfoundland, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: five million dollars to the Province of Prince Edward Island; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the fiscal year commencing on April 1, 1986, sixty-five million dollars to the Province of Manitoba.

Section.Text: The amounts authorized to be paid by section 2 shall be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the fiscal year commencing on April 1, 1985, within thirty days after the coming into force of this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the fiscal year commencing on April 1, 1986, within thirty days after the commencement of that year.
